title: How to Ask for Referrals (Without Being Awkward)
description: Use ChatGPT to write natural referral requests that bring you free leads from happy customers.
requirements: A recent customer who was happy with your work

steps.title: Pick the right moment
steps.description: Timing is everything for referral requests.
substeps: Right after the job when they're happiest — same day or next day
Or after they leave a positive review
Or when they reach out to thank you or compliment your work
steps.tip: Strike while the iron is hot. A week later, they've moved on.

steps.title: Ask ChatGPT to write the request
steps.description: Get a natural-sounding message you can personalize.
substeps: Type: 'Write a short text message asking a happy customer for referrals. I'm a [your trade]. Keep it casual and not salesy.'
Review the options it gives you

steps.title: Personalize it
steps.description: Make it sound like you, not a robot.
substeps: Reference the specific job you did
Example: 'Hey Sarah! Glad you're loving the new fence. If you know anyone else who needs work done, I'd really appreciate a referral. Thanks!'

steps.title: Make it easy to refer
steps.description: Remove friction from the referral process.
substeps: Give them something to share: your phone number, website, or business card
Ask: 'Feel free to pass along my number to anyone who needs help'
Even better: 'Can I leave a few business cards with you?'
steps.tip: Some people love referring but don't know how. Give them the words.

steps.title: Consider a referral incentive
substeps: Simple: 'Send me a referral and I'll buy you a coffee!'
Better: '$25 off your next service for every referral'
Best: '$50 cash or gift card when they book'
Track referrals so you can thank the right people

successMessage: You asked for a referral! Referred customers close 4x faster and spend more than cold leads.
proTips: Ask every single happy customer. The worst they can say is no.
Thank people immediately when they send a referral — even if the lead doesn't close
Add 'How did you hear about us?' to your intake so you can track referral sources
